actions.committee: House Committee on Foreign Affairs (Subsequently: International Relations)
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs (Subsequently: International Relations).

official_title: A bill to amend the Agricultural Trade Development and Assistance Act of 1954 to provide the United States with the flexibility to carry out the national interest or humanitarian objectives of that act.

summary.text: Provides that even though the export of a commodity would reduce the domestic supply of such commodity below that needed to meet domestic requirements, adequate carryover, and anticipated exports for dollars as determined by the Secretary of Agriculture at the time of exportation of such commodity, the Secretary may still export such commodity to carry out the national interest or humanitarian objectives of the Agricultural Trade Development and Assistance Act of 1954.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Agricultural Trade Development and Assistance Act of 1954 to provide the United States with the flexibility to carry out the national interest or humanitarian objectives of that act.
